title: CString

div.b: A String vector.
div.code: + VectorPtr: typedef std::vector< Ptr>;

div.b: A string list.
div.code: + ListPtr: typedef std::list< Ptr>;
+ WritableType: typedef CStringType::RetTrue;

div.b: Compare two strings like strcmp()
div.code: + Compare: static int (const char*const s1, unsigned int l1, const char*const s2, unsigned int l2);

td.div:
The comparison is done using unsigned characters.
return An integer greater than, equal to, or less than 0, according as the string is greater than, equal to, or less than the given string

div.b: Compare two strings like stricmp() (case-insensitive)
div.code: + CompareInsensitive: static int (const char*const s1, unsigned int l1, const char*const s2, unsigned int l2);

td.div:
The comparison is done using unsigned characters.
return An integer greater than, equal to, or less than 0, according as the string is greater than, equal to, or less than the given string

td.h3: Faster implementation of some common routines Public

div.b: Upper case to lower case letter conversion (man 3 tolower)
div.code: + ToLower: static int (int c);

div.b: Lower case to upper case letter conversion (man 3 toupper)
div.code: + ToUpper: static int (int c);

div.b: White-space character test.
div.code: + IsSpace: static bool (int c);

div.b: decimal-digit character test
div.code: + IsDigit: static bool (int c);

div.b: decimal-digit character test (without zero)
div.code: + IsDigitNonZero: static bool (int c);

div.b: alphabetic character test
div.code: + IsAlpha: static bool (int c);

div.b: Default Constructor.
div.code: + CString: ();

div.b: Copy constructor.
div.code: + CString: (const CString& rhs);

div.b: Constructor from a mere CString .
div.code: + CString: (const char*const block, const Size blockSize);

div.b: Constructor from a copy of a substring of 's'.
div.code: template<unsigned int SizeT, bool ExpT, bool ZeroT> + CString: (const CString<SizeT, ExpT, ZeroT>& s, Size offset);

td.div: The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position 'offset'.

div.b: Constructor from a copy of a substring of 's'.
div.code: template<unsigned int SizeT, bool ExpT, bool ZeroT> + CString: (const CString<SizeT, ExpT, ZeroT>& s, Size offset, Size n);

td.div: The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position 'offset' and takes up to 'n' characters (it takes less than n if the end of 's' is reached before).

div.b: Constructor from a copy of a substring of 's' (std::string)
div.code: template<class TraitsT , class AllocT > + CString: (const std::basic_string< char, TraitsT, AllocT>& s, Size offset);

td.div: The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position 'offset'.

div.b: Constructor from a copy of a substring of 's' (std::string)
div.code: template<class TraitsT , class AllocT > + CString: (const std::basic_string< char, TraitsT, AllocT>& s, Size offset, Size n);

td.div: The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position 'offset' and takes up to 'n' characters (it takes less than n if the end of 's' is reached before).

div.b: Constructor by copy from iterator.
div.code: template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2> + CString: (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end);

ul.li: begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence
end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence

div.b: Constructor by copy from iterator.
div.code: template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2, class StringT > + CString: (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end, const StringT& separator);

ul.li: begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence
end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence
separator A string to add between each item

div.b: Constructor with a default value.

div.code: + CString: (size_t n, unsigned char c);

div.b: Destructor.
div.code: + ~ CString: ();

div.b: Assign a new value to the string.
div.code: template<class U > + assign: void (const U& rhs);

div.b: Copy a raw C-String.
div.code: template<class StringT > + assign: void (const StringT& str, const Size size);

ul.li: size Size of the given string

div.b: Copy a raw C-String.
div.code: template<class StringT > + assign: void (const StringT& str, const Size size, const Size offset);

ul.li: size Size of the given string
offset Offset of the first character to copy

div.b: Assign to the string all items within.
div.code: template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2> + assign: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end);

td.div:
The type held by the iterator can be anything as long as the type can be converted by the string (see specializations in the namespace `Yuni::Extension::CString`).
Parameters :
begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence
end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence

div.b: Assign to the string all items within.
div.code: template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2, class StringT > + assign: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end, const StringT& separator);

div.b: Assign to thestring all items within.
div.code: template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2, class StringT , class EnclosureT > + assign: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end, const StringT& separator, const EnclosureT& enclosure);

div.b: Append to the end of the string a new value.
div.code: template<class U > + append: void (const U& rhs);

div.b: Append to the end of the string all items within.
div.code: template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2> + append: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end);

td.div:
The type held by the iterator can be anything as long as it can be converted by the string (see specializations in the namespace Yuni::Extension::CString ).
see : namespace Yuni::Extension::CString
Parameters :
begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence
end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence

div.b: Append to the end of the string all items within.
div.code: template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2, class StringT > + append: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end, const StringT& separator);

div.b: Append a single signed char.
div.code: + put: void (const char c);

div.b: Append a single unsigned char.
div.code: + put: void (const unsigned char c);

div.b: Assign a new value to the string.
div.code: template<class U > + put: void (const U& rhs);

div.b: Insert a raw C-String at a given position in the string.
div.code: + insert: bool (const Size offset, const char*const cstr, const Size size);

ul.li: offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

div.div: return True if the given string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)

div.b: Insert a single item at a given position in the string.
div.code: + insert: bool (const Size offset, const char c);

ul.li: offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

div.div: return True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)

div.b: Insert an arbitrary C-String at a given position in the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + insert: bool (const Size offset, const StringT& s);

ul.li: offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

div.div: return True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)

div.b: Insert an arbitrary C-String at a given position in the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + insert: bool (const Size offset, const StringT& u, const Size size);

ul.li: offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered
size The size to use for the given container

div.div: return True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)

div.b: Insert any arbitrary string at a given offset provided by an iterator.
div.code: template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class StringT > + insert: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& it, const StringT& string);

td.div: If the offset is greater than the size of the string, the value will be merely appended to the string.

div.b: Insert a raw C-String at the beginning of in the string.
div.code: + prepend: bool (const char*const cstr, const Size size);

div.div: return True if the given string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)

div.b: Insert a single item at the beginning of the string.
div.code: + prepend: bool (const char c);

div.div: return True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)

div.b: Insert an arbitrary C-String at the beginning of the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + prepend: bool (const StringT& s);

div.div: return True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)

div.b: Insert an arbitrary C-String at the beginning the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + prepend: bool (const StringT& u, const Size size);

ul.li: size The size to use for the given container

div.div: return True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)

div.b: Overwrite a region of the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + overwrite: void (const Size offset, const StringT& s);

td.div:
The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.
Parameters :
offset Position of the first character of the region in the string
s A CString

div.b: Overwrite a region of the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + overwrite: void (const StringT& s);

td.div:
The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.
Parameters :
s A CString

div.b: Overwrite a region of the string.
div.code: + overwrite: void (const Size offset, const char*const cstr, const Size size);

td.div:
The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.
Parameters :
offset Position of the first character of the region in the string
cstr A C-String
size Size of 'cstr'

div.b: Overwrite a region of the string from the right of the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + overwriteRight: void (const StringT& s);

td.div:
The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.
Parameters :
region A CString container

div.b: Overwrite a region of the string from the right of the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + overwriteRight: void (const Size offset, const StringT& s);

td.div:
The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.
Parameters :
offset Position of the first character (from the right) of the region in the string
region A CString container

ul.li: offset Position of the first character where to start from

div.b: Find the offset of any supported CString (ignoring the case)
div.code: template<class StringT > + irfind: Size (const StringT& s, Size offset) const;

div.div: return The position of the first occurence found, `npos` if not found

div.b: Find the offset of a sub-string from the left.

ul.li: offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

div.div: return The position of the first occurence found, `npos` if not found

ul.li: offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered
len Size of the given string

div.div: return The position of the first occurence found, `npos` if not found

div.b: Erase.
div.code: + chop: void (unsigned int n);

td.div: Remove up to `n` characters from the end of the string

div.b: Remove the last char.
div.code: + removeLast: void ();

div.b: Remove the trailing slash or backslash at the end of the string (if any)
div.code: + removeTrailingSlash: void ();

div.b: Remove all white-spaces (" \t\r\n") from the beginning and the end of the string.
div.code: + trim: void ();

div.b: Remove all white-spaces from the beginning and the end of the string.
div.code: + trim: void (const char c);

div.b: Removes all items equal to one of those in 'whitespaces' from the end of the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + trim: void (const StringT& whitespaces);

div.b: Removes all items equal to one of those in 'u' from the end of the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + trimRight: void (const StringT& whitespaces);

div.b: Remove all items equal to 'c' from the end of the string.
div.code: + trimRight: void (const char c);

div.b: Removes all items equal to one of those in 'u' from the beginning of the string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + trimLeft: void (const StringT& whitespaces);

div.b: Remove all items equal to 'c' from the beginning of the string.
div.code: + trimLeft: void (const char c);

div.b: Empty the string.
div.code: + clear: CString& ();

td.div:
The size will be reset to 0 but the internal data will not be freed. If you want to reduce the memory used by the string, use 'shrink()' instead.
see : shrink()
return Always *this

div.b: Erase a part of the string.
div.code: + erase: void (const Size offset, const Size len);

ul.li: offset The offset (zero-based) of the first item to erase
len The length (in number of items) to erase

div.code: template<class ModelT , bool ConstT> + erase: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& offset, const Size len);

ul.li: offset The offset (zero-based) of the first item to erase
len The length (in number of items) to erase

ul.li: to The string to replace with

ul.li: offset The offset where to start from
to The string to replace with

ul.li: to The string to replace with

to The string to replace with

div.b: Remove the 'n' first characters.
div.code: + consume: void (Size n);

div.b: Convert the case (lower case) of characters in the string (O(N))
div.code: + toLower: CString& ();

div.b: Convert the case (upper case) of characters in the string (O(N))
div.code: + toUpper: CString& ();

div.b: Get if the string is equals to another one.
div.code: template<class StringT > + equals: bool (const StringT& rhs) const;

td.div: This method is equivalent to the operator '=='

div.b: Get if the string is equals to another one (ignoring case)
div.code: template<class StringT > + equalsInsensitive: bool (const StringT& rhs) const;

td.div: This method is equivalent to the operator '=='

div.b: Compare the string with another one.
div.code: template<class StringT > + compare: int (const StringT& rhs) const;

td.div:
The comparison is done using unsigned characters.
return An integer greater than, equal to, or less than 0, according as the string is greater than, equal to, or less than the given string

div.b: Compare the string with another one (ignoring the case)
div.code: template<class StringT > + compareInsensitive: int (const StringT& rhs) const;

td.div:
The comparison is done using unsigned characters.
return An integer greater than, equal to, or less than 0, according as the string is greater than, equal to, or less than the given string

div.b: Convert the string into something else.
div.code: template<class U > + to: U () const;

td.div:
The supported types (by default) are :
std::string
const char* (equivalent to `c_str()`)
numeric (int, long, unsigned int, double...)
bool

div.b: Convert the string into something else.
div.code: template<class U > + to: bool (U& out) const;

td.div:
This method is strictly equivalent to `to()`, except that we know if the conversion succeeded or not.
Parameters :
out The variable where to store the result of the conversion
return True if the conversion succeeded. False otherwise

div.b: Get the next UTF-8 character.
div.code: template<bool InvalidateOffsetIfErrorT> + utf8next: UTF8::Error (Size& offset, UTF8::Char& out) const;

ul.li: InvalidateOffsetIfErrorT True to automatically set the offset parameter to `(Size)-1` when the result is not `errNone`

div.div: return True if an UTF8 char has been found, false otherwise ( offset may become invalid)

div.b: Get the item at a given position in a safe way.
div.code: + at: int (const Size offset) const;

td.div:
Contrary to the operator [], it is safe to use an invalid offset
return The item at position offset , a default value if the offset is out of bound

div.b: Truncate the string to the given length.
div.code: + truncate: void (const Size newSize);

td.div:
Nothing will be done if the new size if greater than the current one.
Parameters :
newSize The new size (in bytes)

div.b: Ensure that there is enough allocated space for X characters.
div.code: + reserve: void (Size minCapacity);

td.div:
The content will remain untouched.
Parameters :
minCapacity The minimum capacity of the string (in bytes)

div.b: Resize the string to 'len' bytes.
div.code: + resize: void (const Size len);

td.div:
The content will remain untouched.
Parameters :
len The new length (in bytes) of the string

div.b: Resize the string to 'len' bytes and fill the new content (if any)
div.code: template<class StringT > + resize: void (const Size len, const StringT& pattern);

div.b: Releases any memory not required to store the character data.
div.code: + shrink: void ();

td.div: If the string is empty, the internal buffer will be freed. Otherwise the buffer will be reallocated to reduce as much as possible the amount of memory used by the string. It does not modify the size of the string, only its capacity. This method has no effect if the string is not expandable.

div.b: Perform a full check about UTF8 validity.
div.code: + utf8valid: bool () const;

td.div: This check will iterate through the whole string to detect any bad-formed UTF8 character.

div.b: Perform a full check about UTF8 validity.
div.code: + utf8valid: UTF8::Error (Size& offset) const;

td.div:
This check will iterate through the whole string to detect any bad-formed UTF8 character.
Parameters :
offset The offset in the string of the misformed UTF8 character
return UTF8::errNone if the string is valid

div.b: Perform a fast check about UTF8 validity.
div.code: + utf8validFast: bool () const;

td.div:
Contrary to `utf8valid()`, this check is only based on the first code point of an UTF8 sequence. Consequently, it does not perform a full compliance test and you should prefer `utf8valid()`. As a consequence it may report that the string is a valid UTF8 string even if it is not the case, but it may be good enough in some cases.
see : utf8valid()

div.b: Compute the number of UTF-8 characters.
div.code: + utf8size: Size () const;

div.b: Get the current size of the string (in bytes)
div.code: + size: Size () const;

td.div: The returned value is less than or equal to the capacity, and greater or equal to the number of UTF8 characters in the string.

div.code: + length: Size () const;
+ sizeInBytes: size_t () const;

div.b: the maximum number of characters that the string object can hold (for STL compliance)
div.code: + max_size: size_t () const;

div.b: Get if the cstr is empty.
div.code: + empty: bool () const;

div.source:
String s; s.empty(); // returns true s.null(); // returns true
s = "hello world" ; // returns false s.empty(); // returns false s.null(); // returns false
s.clear(); s.empty(); // returns true s.null(); // returns false
s.shrink(); s.empty(); // returns true s.null(); // returns true

div.b: Get if the cstr is null.
div.code: + null: bool () const;

td.div:
A null cstr means that no space is reserved, and that the method `data()` will return NULL.
String s; s.empty(); // returns true s.null(); // returns true
s = "hello world" ; // returns false s.empty(); // returns false s.null(); // returns false
s.clear(); s.empty(); // returns true s.null(); // returns false
s.shrink(); s.empty(); // returns true s.null(); // returns true

div.b: Get if the string is not empty (the exact opposite of `empty()`)
div.code: + notEmpty: bool () const;

div.b: Get the current capacity of the string (in bytes)
div.code: + capacity: Size () const;

div.div: return The amount of memory used by the string

div.code: + capacityInBytes: size_t () const;

div.b: A pointer to the original cstr (might be NULL)
div.code: + c_str: const char* () const;

div.b: A pointer to the original cstr (might be NULL)
div.code: + data: const char* () const;

div.b: Get the item at a given position in a safe way.
div.code: + data: char* ();

td.div:
Contrary to the operator [], it is safe to use an invalid offset
return The item at position offset , a default value if the offset is out of bound

div.b: Reset the current value with a formatted string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + format: CString& (const StringT& format, ... );

td.div:
The format is the standard printf format.
Parameters :
format The format, reprensented by a zero-terminated string
return Always *this

div.b: Append formatted string.
div.code: template<class StringT > + appendFormat: CString& (const StringT& format, ... );

td.div:
The format is the standard printf format.
Parameters :
format The format, represented by a zero-terminated string
return Always *this

div.b: Append a formatted string to the end of the current string.
div.code: + vappendFormat: void (const char* format, va_list args);

td.div:
The format is the standard printf format.
Parameters :
format The format, represented by a zero-terminated C-String
args The arguments required by the format

div.b: Get the first char of the string.
div.code: + first: char () const;

div.div: return The last char of the string if not empty, \0 otherwise

div.b: Get the last char of the string.
div.code: + last: char () const;

div.div: return The last char of the string if not empty, \0 otherwise

div.b: Get if the string matches a simple pattern ('*' only managed)
div.code: template<class StringT > + glob: bool (const StringT& pattern) const;

td.div:
Parameters :
pattern A pattern
warning : This method should not be used in a new code and will be removed as soon as possible
Todo To be removed as soon as possible

div.b: Convert all backslashes into slashes.
div.code: + convertBackslashesIntoSlashes: void ();

div.b: Convert all slashes into backslashes.
div.code: + convertSlashesIntoBackslashes: void ();

div.b: Iterate through all words in the string, all separated by one of the given separators.
div.code: template<class StringT , class PredicateT > + words: void (const StringT& separators, const PredicateT& predicate) const;

div.b: Split a string into several segments.
div.code: template<template< class, class>class ListT, class UType , class Alloc , typename StringT > + split: void (ListT< UType, Alloc>& out, const StringT& sep, bool keepEmptyElements, bool trimElements, bool emptyBefore) const;

td.div:
Here is an example of how to convert a string to a list of int :  std::list<int>   list;
  String ( "22::80::443::993" ).split(list,  ":" );
  std::cout  <<  list  <<  std::endl;



warning :  Performance Tip: For better performances, the method words will suit better

Parameters :
 out All segments that have been found

 sep Sequence of chars considered as a separator

 keepEmptyElements True to keep empty items

 trimElements Trim each item found

 emptyBefore True to clear the vector before fulfill it

warning :  This method does not take care of string representation (with `'` or `"`)

see :  words()

div.b: Duplicate N times the content of the string.
div.code: + duplicate: void (int n);

div.b: Extract the key and its value from a string (mainly provided by TDF files or Ini files)
div.code: template<class StringT1 , class StringT2 > + extractKeyValue: void (StringT1& key, StringT2& value, bool ignoreCase) const;

td.div:
Simple Ini file structure [section] key = value
More complex : [section] a = b; // Put your comments here b = c = ; // b = c, empty values return carriage = A long string\non two lines "key" = "All characters are allowed here, like semicolons; :)"
Parameters :
key The key that has been found
value The associated value
ignoreCase True to be case insensitive
see : ExtractKeyvalue()

+ CString: typedef;
